articles.headline: Holiday Travel Is Bargain Spot for the Willing
articles.snippet: Bracing for a painful holiday season, hotels, airlines and cruise operators are offering deals to entice vacationers.
articles.abstract: Bracing for a painful holiday season, hotels, airlines and cruise operators are offering deals to entice vacationers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The travel industry is bracing for a painful holiday season as people scale back their discretionary spending. But that is good news for anyone who has yet to book a winter getaway, with hotels, airlines and cruise operators introducing last-minute deals to entice vacationers.

articles.headline: G.M.’s Pension Fund Stays Afloat, Against the Odds
articles.snippet: G.M. appears to have enough money in the fund to pay its more than 400,000 retirees their benefits for many years — a result of its conservative pension management.
articles.abstract: G.M. appears to have enough money in the fund to pay its more than 400,000 retirees their benefits for many years — a result of its conservative pension management.
articles.lead_paragraph: When General Motors left Washington empty-handed last week, among the lingering questions was whether its huge pension fund could topple and crush the government’s pension insurance program.

articles.headline: Where the Traffic Median Is a No-Pilates Zone
articles.snippet: After complaints from residents, Santa Monica officers are breaking up unauthorized exercising on traffic medians.
articles.abstract: After complaints from residents, Santa Monica officers are breaking up unauthorized exercising on traffic medians.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  From his squad car on a sun-drenched corner, Lemont Davis, a Santa Monica park ranger, spotted the perpetrator: white male, 40 to 45 years old, feet pressed against palm tree, legs fully extended in situp position.

articles.headline: Slump May Limit Moves on Clean Energy
articles.snippet: A poor global economy and plunging prices for coal and oil are upending plans to curb the use of fossil fuels.
articles.abstract: A poor global economy and plunging prices for coal and oil are upending plans to curb the use of fossil fuels.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just as the world seemed poised to combat global warming more aggressively, the economic slump and plunging prices of coal and oil are upending plans to wean businesses and consumers from fossil fuel.

articles.headline: Redstone Weighs Sale of Theaters
articles.snippet: In order to stave off dismantling his media empire, Sumner M. Redstone, the controlling shareholder of Viacom and CBS, may sell his movie-theater chain.
articles.abstract: In order to stave off dismantling his media empire, Sumner M. Redstone, the controlling shareholder of Viacom and CBS, may sell his movie-theater chain.
articles.lead_paragraph: In an effort to stave off the dismantling of his media empire, Sumner M. Redstone, the controlling shareholder of Viacom and CBS, recently proposed to sell his family’s 1,500-screen theater chain in an effort to restructure his large debt load.

articles.headline: Where Was Geithner in Turmoil?
articles.snippet: The experience that Timothy F. Geithner, former head of the N.Y. Fed and current nominee for Treasury secretary, brings to the table can be looked at as an asset or a liability.
articles.abstract: The experience that Timothy F. Geithner, former head of the N.Y. Fed and current nominee for Treasury secretary, brings to the table can be looked at as an asset or a liability.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Barack Obama unveiled on Monday an economic team with deep experience handling economic crises. But does the man at the center of this star-studded cast, Timothy F. Geithner, the nominee for Treasury secretary, have what is needed to take the nation in a new financial direction?

articles.headline: Obama and Bush Working to Calm Volatile Market
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve and the Treasury plan to announce a lending program Tuesday to jump-start frozen loan markets, administration officials said.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve and the Treasury plan to announce a lending program Tuesday to jump-start frozen loan markets, administration officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  President-elect Barack Obama sought to seize the reins of the economic crisis Monday as he and his new economic team worked closely with President Bush to inject confidence into the trembling financial markets, which rallied and erased most of last week’s losses.

articles.headline: Saving Citi May Create More Fear
articles.snippet: The government’s bailout of Citigroup could lead other banks to take bigger risks.
articles.abstract: The government’s bailout of Citigroup could lead other banks to take bigger risks.
articles.lead_paragraph: One bailout was not enough for Citigroup. And it may not be enough for other big banks.

articles.headline: Buffett to Offer Details on Derivatives
articles.snippet: With shares of Berkshire Hathaway down 36 percent since Oct. 1, Warren E. Buffett said he would shed some light on his investments in the company’s next annual report.
articles.abstract: With shares of Berkshire Hathaway down 36 percent since Oct. 1, Warren E. Buffett said he would shed some light on his investments in the company’s next annual report.
articles.lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett has long been an proponent of transparency and a critic of murky financial instruments. Now, as his investment firm’s stock takes its worst beating in years, America’s avuncular prophet of capitalism is promising to shed some light on his own opaque investments.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: U.S. Details $800 Billion Loan Plans
articles.snippet: The Fed and the Treasury signaled that they would print as much money as needed to revive the banking system.
articles.abstract: The Fed and the Treasury signaled that they would print as much money as needed to revive the banking system.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve and the Treasury announced $800 billion in new lending programs on Tuesday, sending a message that they would print as much money as needed to revive the nation’s crippled banking system.
